title: How to Make a Banana Smoothie

steps.title: Add a peeled and sliced banana into a blender.
steps.content: Add a peeled and sliced banana into a blender. For a thicker smoothie, use a frozen banana. If you don't have a blender, you can use a food processor fitted with metal blades instead.

steps.title: Add the milk, yogurt, and oatmeal.
steps.content: Add the milk, yogurt, and oatmeal. For a sweeter smoothie, use vanilla yogurt. For a less sweet smoothie, use plain yogurt. You can also omit the milk and use more yogurt for an even thicker smoothie.

steps.title: Top it off with some cinnamon, honey, and peanut butter.
steps.content: Top it off with some cinnamon, honey, and peanut butter. The cinnamon will add a hint of spice and flavor to the smoothie, while the honey will add a touch of sweetness. The peanut butter will add some extra protein. If you are using peanut butter, be sure to use the smooth kind; it will be much easier to blend than the chunky kind. If you like your smoothies extra cold and thick, add some ice cubes.

steps.title: Blend the ingredients until everything is smooth and evenly combined.
steps.content: Blend the ingredients until everything is smooth and evenly combined. Occasionally, pause the blender and push the ingredients down the walls of the blender. This will ensure that everything gets evenly mixed and that no lumps remain.

steps.title: Pour the smoothie into a tall glass and serve.
steps.content: Pour the smoothie into a tall glass and serve. You can enjoy it as it is, or you can garnish it with a sprinkle of oatmeal, a dash of cinnamon, or a drizzle of honey.

steps.title: Peel and slice a banana, and put it into a blender.
steps.content: Peel and slice a banana, and put it into a blender. For a thicker smoothie, use a frozen banana instead. If you don't have a blender, you can use a food processor fitted with metal blades.

steps.title: Add the milk and honey.
steps.content: Add the milk and honey. The more milk you use, the thinner smoothie you will get. For a thicker smoothie, use plain or vanilla yogurt instead. For extra protein, add 3 tablespoons (45 grams) of peanut butter. [1] X Research source For extra flavor, add a pinch of ground cinnamon. If you can't find any honey, you can use sugar, agave nectar, stevia, or even maple syrup instead.

steps.title: Top it off with ice, if desired.
steps.content: Top it off with ice, if desired. If you are using frozen bananas, then you can skip the ice cubes—unless you like really thick smoothies.

steps.title: Blend the ingredients until everything is smooth and evenly combined.
steps.content: Blend the ingredients until everything is smooth and evenly combined. There should be no lumps or clumps. From time to time, you may have to pause the blender, open it up, and push the ingredients down the sides with a rubber spatula. Depending on what type of blender you have, you may need to choose a setting, such as: "smoothie," "blend," or "puree."

steps.title: Pour the smoothie into a glass and serve.
steps.content: Pour the smoothie into a glass and serve. You can enjoy it as it is, or you can garnish it with a dollop of whipped cream, banana slices, or a drizzle of honey.

steps.title: Prepare the fruit.
steps.content: Prepare the fruit. Peel and slice the banana. Rinse the strawberries, cut off the stems, and cut them into quarters or halves (to make blending easier). Rinse the blueberries. For a thicker smoothie, you can use frozen bananas instead.

steps.title: Add the fruit into the blender.
steps.content: Add the fruit into the blender. If you don't have a blender, use a food processor fitted with metal blades instead.

steps.title: Add the juice and yogurt.
steps.content: Add the juice and yogurt. If you'd like your smoothie to be sweet, add in the honey. If you don't have any agave nectar, you can use another sweetener, such as honey, stevia, or sugar.

steps.title: Top it off with ice.
steps.content: Top it off with ice. If you are using frozen bananas, then you can use less ice or skip it entirely.

steps.title: Blend the ingredients until they smooth and evenly combined.
steps.content: Blend the ingredients until they smooth and evenly combined. From time to time, you may have to pause the blender, open it up, and push the ingredients down the sides with a spatula. Keep pulsing and mixing until there are no lumps or chunks left.

steps.title: Pour the smoothie into a glass and serve.
steps.content: Pour the smoothie into a glass and serve. You can serve it as it is, or garnish it with a few banana slices, a sliced strawberry, or a few blueberries.

steps.title: Pour the almond milk into a blender or food processor.
steps.content: Pour the almond milk into a blender or food processor. If you can't find any almond milk, you can make your own by blending 1 cup (240 milliliters) of water and ½ cup (70 grams) of almonds.

steps.title: Add the spinach and puree it with the almond milk.
steps.content: Add the spinach and puree it with the almond milk. You may have to work in a few batches, since spinach leaves can be tricky to blend. Keep pulsing until the leaves are completely blended with the almond milk. Mixing the spinach in first will give you a smoother drink in the end. Don't worry, you won't taste the spinach after it is done. It will turn the smoothie an interesting shade of green and add tons of nutrients, however!

steps.title: Peel and slice the banana, then add it into the blender.
steps.content: Peel and slice the banana, then add it into the blender. For a thicker smoothie, you can use a frozen banana instead. At this point, you can also add 5 to 6 ice cubes; it will make your smoothie colder and thicker.

steps.title: Add the peanut butter and honey.
steps.content: Add the peanut butter and honey. For extra fiber, add some chia seeds. Also, try to use smooth peanut butter instead the chunky kind. It will be easier to blend and give you a smoother smoothie in the end.

steps.title: Blend the ingredients until everything is smooth and evenly combined.
steps.content: Blend the ingredients until everything is smooth and evenly combined. From time to time, pause your blender, and push the ingredients down the sides using a spatula. This will help the ingredients mix together more evenly.

steps.title: Pour the smoothie into a tall glass and enjoy.
steps.content: Pour the smoothie into a tall glass and enjoy. It is packed with nutrients and protein, and will keep you full for hours. It makes an ideal breakfast!

steps.title: Pulse the banana and half-and-half in a blender.
steps.content: Pulse the banana and half-and-half in a blender. Peel and slice the banana first, then add it to the blender. Pour the half-and-half over the banana, then blend until evenly combined. This will create a nice, smooth base for your drink. For a thicker smoothie, use a frozen banana instead. For a lighter smoothie, use whole milk or skim milk instead of half-and-half.

steps.title: Add the maple syrup, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
steps.content: Add the maple syrup, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. These will give your smoothie a layer complexity and a final boost of flavor. If you aren't a fan of maple syrup, you can use another sweetener instead, such as: agave nectar, honey, jam, molasses, sugar, etc.

steps.title: Consider adding crumbled graham crackers for an extra crunch.
steps.content: Consider adding crumbled graham crackers for an extra crunch. You can also use 2 crumbled vanilla wafer cookies instead. [2] X Research source At this point, you can also add other flavors as well. Here are some ideas to get you started: Add some cocoa or mini chocolate chips for a subtle chocolate flavor. [3] X Research source Make a spicy-sweet smoothie by adding ¼ teaspoon (0.65 grams) of cayenne.

steps.title: Blend until the ingredients are silky smooth.
steps.content: Blend until the ingredients are silky smooth. You don't want any lumps, chunks, or swirls. From time to time, you may have to pause the blender, and push the ingredients down the sides using a rubber spatula; this will ensure that everything gets evenly blended.

steps.title: Pour the smoothie into a tall glass, and serve it.
steps.content: Pour the smoothie into a tall glass, and serve it. You can drink it as is, or you can garnish it with extra cinnamon, nutmeg, or banana slices. To make it truly dessert-like, garnish it with a swirl of whipped cream, a drizzle of chocolate syrup, and a dash of colorful sprinkles; finish it off with a maraschino cherry on top.
